result.execSummary:
The defendant Zaporah E McGregory was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Successfully complete any other parenting classes deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete cognitive intervention training.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Offer placed on the record by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant sentenced to serve 1 MONTH in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days time served and Huber release privileges.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 6 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Mental health evaluation and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
* Successfully complete any other parenting classes deemed appropriate.
* Successfully complete cognitive intervention training.
* Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 11/4/17.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.
* Defendant must submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Law intern Andrea Fendry under the supervision of Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  On motion of the state, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Offer placed on the record by the state.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and elements, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a judgment of conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.

Court ordered defendant to submit a DNA sample.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for Plea/sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Defendant was given the wrong court date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Due to the lateness of the hour and court congestion, case adjourned to Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, defense requests an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, defense requests an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Bridget Krause for Robert J Hampton with student intern Dan Larsen.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan - Branch 31 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Zoe Everett in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Defendant informed her attorney she is attending a funeral.  Defendant to provide proof of such. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Due to changes in the DA's office, defense was unable to work out the DPA.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense motion for an adjournment.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel is working on resolving this matter with a DPA.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel is working on resolving this matter with a DPA.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:30 P.M. ON 2/9/16.  IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Zaporah E McGregory in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 21 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2-8-2016 at 1:30pm
